summary: Do it like a warrior, wrap up your wounds after the fight with these soft cotton bandages...you can\'t use them during combat.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://privat.bahnhof.se/wb220832/skyrim/mods/Bandages/bandages.png[/img]

Mod Name: Bandages
Version: 1.4
Author: Ceano
Contact: ceano at gmx.com
**************************


About the Mod:
--------------
Do it like a warrior, use bandages and not potions.

Wrap up your wounds after the fight with these soft cotton bandages,
you can\'t use them during combat...if you try you only lose them.


Bandages and Wraps:
-------------------
* Now you need to clean the linnen wraps before you use them as bandages.

There is three types of bandges, so far...

* Bandage Heal Wounds:
  +6 heal rate for 10 seconds.

* Bandage Heal Diseased Wounds:
  +4 heal rate for 10 seconds and cure Disease 100%.

* Bandage Heal Poisoned Wounds:
  +2 heal rate for 10 seconds and cure Poison 100%.


You can craft bandages and Bandage Wraps at any tanning rack...

* Bandage Wraps (cleaning dirty linnen wraps):
  1 Linen Wrap + 1 Salt Pile.

* Bandage Heal Wounds:
  2 Tundra Cotton or 1 Bandage Wrap + 2 Blue Mountain Flowers.

* Bandage Heal Diseased Wounds:
  2 Tundra Cotton or 1 Bandage Wrap + 2 Mudcrab Chitin.

* Bandage Heal Poisoned Wounds:
  2 Tundra Cotton or 1 Bandage Wrap + 2 Thistle Branch.


Potions:
--------
You can only find Health Potions that heals up to 75 point in loot,
better potions need to be made or bought. All health regeneration boost
potions is replaced with Heal Wounds bandages, in loot and in the open world.


Working on:
---------------
Trying to figure out how to make everything at an alchemy lab, instead of
at a taning rack.

(any one who can give me a clue how to do this, will be named in the readme)


Note:
-----
* This works also for those who have disbeled the health regenaration
  (auto heling), for the player or all races.

* Abandoned the optional .esp\'s, ether you like it as is...or you don\'t ;)


Installation:
-------------
Copy \"Data\" folder to your Skyrim root directory, overwrite if asked.


//Ceano
